text: [Applause]
tedex is all about spreading ideas but
what if you had an idea and you wanted
to communicate it with the person
sitting next to you but you knew when
you opened your mouth the words wouldn't
come out it might sound like I'm quoting
the lyrical genius rapper Eminem but no
this is how you might feel when you're
nervous shy scared embarrassed or just
flly uncomfortable for people that have
a speech impediment this is how they
feel all the time before they're about
to speak I was born in taban which is on
the Northern side of Iran close to the
borders of aan now in tabis the language
AAR is also spoken but it's also the
native language of aeran I grew up in a
household where isai was spoken at home
and it was exposed to Turkish in various
forms of media and farsy everywhere else
because it's the most commonly spoken
language in Iran now with being exposed
to these three languages my family
created its own hybrid language which
consist consisted of these three
languages so we would say words that
would mean the same thing but would be
easier to say so if a word meant the
same thing but only had two syllables
compared to a word that had three
syllables I would just say the word that
had two syllables pretty simple but I
did that more than my parents and the
reason I did this wasn't because it was
easier I just couldn't say so I would
substitute easier words and say this
now I had a speaking problem at the time
but it wasn't a parent people just
assumed I was going through my baby talk
phase but it wasn't when I moved to
America in '96 this all changed I got
introduced to English this language is
not like none of those
three there's no overlap the sounds are
different it's a complete new world so
only person that speaks English in my
household is a TV
so my dad came here before so he was my
role model I looked up to him because he
could speak at the best now when it came
to me staying at home I just watched TV
got a little bit of English here and
there but I didn't really speak it I was
embarrassed to speak it cuz I couldn't
speak it but this became obvious through
my lack of speaking so I used to speak
with my body language if I wanted to
talk I used to acted out like St I used
to read your body language and rep turn
now my shra phase as my parents called
it became evident when I was in
preschool because preschool there is a
moment which my parents will never let
me live down because the teacher even
called my parents and told them to come
in class well the teacher has reading
time in during reading time the teacher
sits in her rocking chair rocks back and
forth reads her book and makes all a SI
crisscross applesauce on the carpet
listen to her there's two problems here
I can't read your body language when
you're just rocking back and forth and I
don't understand English so as a toddler
I can only listen for so long before I
get bored and when I get bored I was
combing this girl's hair in front of me
like a pers and
Cat now there's two things I'm confused
about besides what the teacher was
speaking if the girl liked me back
because it was Apparent from my body
language I liked her but that's a whole
different talk in a whole different
language now as time goes on I go into
Elementary School in elementary school
it became more evident that I had
trouble speaking so I went to see a
therapist a speech therapist we worked
together to pinpoint areas where I
struggled and at one point I thought it
was like the entire alphabet I struggled
with but I figured it out it was CH c s
t h T's okay I stop there but there were
a few of them so we worked on sounds but
then we worked on phrases phrases were
especially difficult because I had to
say words that she told me to say and I
knew I couldn't say him and she knew
that too which was bad so we worked with
these phrases but these phrases were
like tongue twisters you guys know the
tongue twister in English Sally sells
come on say with me Sally sells
seashells on the seash yeah I never
really learned that but that's not the
point she made me say this but I never
could say it so I would go home with she
told me to practice this I wouldn't I
would uh go home and go to my best
friend the thesaurus because it had the
answer to what I lack the words I could
say but meant the same thing so that
exact same thing you said that's how I
feel when I was speaking English but I
substituted that so it became Sally
hustles she shows on the
beach well you get the gist but doesn't
really sound the same and that's still
how the way I speak now I use that word
a lot so if you're around me you're
going to hear hustle hustle hustle a
bunch you're going to wonder why doesn't
this kid ever say the word sell that's
the reason
why so I got teased while I was going to
school because I used to talk like this
Growing Up So this put me in a state of
isolation but inside this isolation is
where I found my passion this passion
was running because when I ran in
elementary school I didn't have to talk
and no one talk to me it was my safe
area but when I ran there was something
I was running away from the problem at
hand but I enjoyed running so my fifth
grade uh my school put on a prize
whoever ran the most miles gets a prize
and I thought subconsciously if I ran
the most miles I will get a prize and I
will earn the respect of these kids that
tease me where I ran the most miles I
got the prize I got some respect but
that didn't change my speaking I was
running away from the problem it wasn't
until High School someone said ason if
you want to be successful you have to
get out your comfort zone and I did that
exact thing but what happened is that my
flaws were being exploited so when I
speak I failed and people laughed but
the laughter for once didn't stop me
kept me going the laughter motivated me
because I knew when I laughed with them
I was connecting with them that
connection was something I avoided all
my life so I failed failed failed I
connected connected connected and this
is where the hello world moment hit me
this is the part where my weakness
becomes a strength now I wanted to take
my philosophy getting out my comfort
zone to a new level so a person that
can't speak English very well takes a
job selling so at first job I started
selling Pool Supplies I went from being
a shy employee within 3 months I had
some of the highest units sold so I
wanted to do this again so what I did I
started selling cars now I don't look
like the typical car salesman but man I
had a huge learning curve to go through
I wasn't the loudest one at the car
dealership but I did talk the most if
you go back to the dealership and ask
who talk the most without skipping the
beat everyone there would say my name
and from this process of just continuing
this philosophy of just getting out my
comfort zone even standing up here
getting out my comfort zone I've
realized that something that I viewed as
a weakness something I avoided something
I even ran away from I HD it
straightforward and I solved that
problem by turning that weakness into a
strength then I turned it into a asset
by capitalizing on it by seeing what I
could do with it putting me in a
position where I had to do that and face
it now through this process I've turned
that weakness into a passion I love
talking anytime you see me I'm probably
talking now I'm going to live you with
this speak loudly speak proudly and get
out of your comfort zone thank you
[Applause]
